job_description: Employer                      : SkyTrac Systems Ltd.Position Title                :  Embedded Software Development Coop StudentStart of Workterm       : May, 2015Job Location                 : Kelowna, British Columbia, CanadaNumber of Positions     : 1Length of Workterm   :  4-8 monthsJob description:Position: SkyTrac Systems Ltd. has an opening within their Embedded Software Department for self-motivated Coop Students to help us continue adding value to our embedded satellite modem and GPS products, see www.SkyTrac.ca.SkyTrac develops its hardware, embedded software and software systems in-house. You will report to the Team Lead and be responsible for working with the embedded software team on numerous embedded software and hardware development projects, including embedded real-time software development using compilers, linkers, microcontrollers and related tools. You will gain exposure to the aerospace industry, avionics systems design and Transport Canada regulatory compliance issues.Period of Employment: A period of 4 or 8 months depending upon student availability.Location: Kelowna, BCDuties:• Develop/maintain/test embedded software applications.• Develop/maintain software configuration management and automation scripts.• Design and write test plans for embedded software verification.• Conduct formal software test and document results.• Write technical documentation for SkyTrac System’s products.
job_requirements: Skills Required/Desired:• Programming using C/C++, HTML and Java Script with an emphasis on C programming• Debug and integration of code using IDE’s• Knowledge of electronics at the circuit board level.• Ability to write clearly.Qualifications:• Positive work attitude.• Strong problem solving skills augmented by a good attention to detail.• Excellent communication, planning and time management skills.Additional Assets:• Real-time operating systems.• Software configuration management tools and principals (preferably svn).• Serial communication protocols.Education:• Currently in school for a degree in Electrical/Electronic, Computer Science or related subject.Open To All Majors:No
